meanings.definition: A plant that grows in water or in very wet areas.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophyte in the pond has long, thin leaves to help it survive in the water.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the different types of hydrophytes found in the marsh.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophyte in the flooded garden seemed to be enjoying the excess water.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophyte swayed gently in the lake, embracing its watery home.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the hydrophyte stood out against the dark water.

meanings.definition: A plant adapted to living in water or in waterlogged soil.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophyte's roots are specially designed to absorb nutrients from the water.
meanings.sent2: In the wetlands, you can find many different species of hydrophytes thriving.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophyte in the soggy field seemed to be doing a happy dance in the mud.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophyte's ability to flourish in waterlogged areas is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals of the hydrophyte shimmered in the sunlight filtering through the water.
